channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Trump says he was 'amazed that Harvey Weinstein got scholnged'
item.description: Donald Trump, during an interview on the Dan Bongino Show, discussed how he was surprised Harvey Weinstein faced severe punishment despite being backed by Democrats. Trump referred to Weinstein as the 'king of the woke' and said Democrats typically protect their own. “But boy — you don’t know him well, I don’t know him well, but I watched that and it was amazing. So when they do get hit, they get hit. But that’s the only one I can think of, normally they protect everybody,” he continued. “What they did was Adams, I think, is very suspect.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Are Meghan and Harry buying a house in Portugal? King Charles has a message
item.description: Royal experts are also aware that Harry and Meghan are buying a house in Portugal and they believe that King Charles' message to them would be of indifference. King Charles is not going to "concern himself" with the news, experts claimed. King Charles evicted them from their Windsor property after they left the family and defamed the family in the public but the King will not be perturbed by the news.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It's the First Amendment, stupid ...' Federal judge slams DeSantis administration for threats against TV stations
item.description: A federal court has ordered Florida Governor Ron DeSantis to halt threats against broadcasters airing a pro-abortion rights ad. The state's health department labeled the ad as "false," prompting stations to cease airing it. The court ruled such actions as unconstitutional and anti-First Amendment, granting a temporary restraining order.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel & its Iran-aligned foes vow war will go on
item.description: Israel, Hamas, and Hezbollah vow to continue their conflicts following the death of Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar. Israeli PM Netanyahu sees Sinwar's killing as a milestone but states the war is not over. US President Biden calls for peace efforts, though challenges remain.

item.title: Who is Ashwin Ramaswami, first Gen-Z Indian-American candidate to run for US state legislature
item.description: Ashwin Ramaswami, a young Democrat from Johns Creek, is challenging the incumbent state senator, who was indicted alongside former President Trump for alleged interference in Georgia's 2020 election. Ramaswami emphasizes law and order, has raised significant campaign funds, and focuses on healthcare and housing issues. He aims to prove the Democrats' stance on election integrity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Overweight...never smoker': 5 things to know about Donald Trump's health
item.description: ​Donald Trump is 6 feet 3 inches tall, according to records. His weight is 244 pounds (110 kg). He is medically obese. However, there are many records of Trump's height and weight. He self-reported his weight as 215 pounds (97.5 kg) in 2020. Another record from 2018 said his weight was 239 pounds (108 kg).
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Doug Emhoff, Tim Walz take rapid fire from children; reveal favorite food, music
item.description: Kamala Harris's husband, Doug Emhoff, and Democrat nominee Tim Walz shared a light moment with their children in an Arizona cafe. They discussed their favorite music and food, mentioning artists like Springsteen and REM. They enjoyed cinnamon buns and urged everyone to participate in the elections, emphasizing the importance of voting.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Centuries old copy of US Constitution sells for $9 million at North Carolina auction
item.description: A rare 237-year-old copy of the US Constitution was sold for $9 million at a private auction by Brunk Auctions in North Carolina. This copy, discovered in Edenton, North Carolina, is one of only eight known to exist today. Accompanied by a letter from George Washington, it highlights the historical significance of the document.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump earned money from overcharging Secret Service through Washington hotel, says report
item.description: House Democrats claim former President Trump charged exorbitant rates to the Secret Service for rooms at his hotel during his presidency, reportedly profiting from taxpayer funds and breaching the Domestic Emoluments Clause by accepting these payments. Evidence includes billing records revealing significant markups on room rates compared to standard prices.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Unverified Reddit post claiming Kamala Harris said 'Oh my God, it's over' going viral
item.description: An unverified Reddit post claiming that Kamala Harris said 'Oh my God, it's over' -- after her Fox News interview -- went viral, though there is no confirmation about it and social media users claimed that it's possible that it's fake. The post writer claimed to be a friend of a person who was in the camera crew for the said interview and Kamala Harris was struggling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Liam Payne seen arguing with mystery woman before death: Who is she?
item.description: "I’ll give you $20,000 dollars just because I can. I have $55 million and I like to help people," Liam Payne told a mystery woman with whom he was arguing at the hotel lobby hours before his death. The woman was speaking in Spanish and the hotel manager was translating it for Liam.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I'm going to see Murdoch': Trump says Fox should curb negative ads on him
item.description: Donald Trump expressed his discontent with negative political ads against him on Fox News and plans to ask Rupert Murdoch to remove them. Despite his regular appearances, Trump has criticized the network's coverage. Trump calls for a halt on negative ads for 21 days, citing their unfairness.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump doesn't like calls to deploy Nikki Haley: 'I'll do what I have to do'
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign is reportedly in discussions to bring former UN ambassador Nikki Haley on board to assist with his campaign in the final weeks before the election. Despite past conflicts and Haley's prior run against him, Trump acknowledges her efforts while expressing mixed feelings about the collaboration. ​​“But let me just tell you: Nikki Haley and I fought, and I beat her by 50, 60, 90 points. I beat her in her own state. … I beat Nikki badly,” Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump again trying to silence Stormy Daniels with another hush money deal? Adult actor says this
item.description: Amid reports of Donald Trump attempting another hush money deal with Stormy Daniels ahead of the 2024 election, sources reveal his attorneys' offer to lower her owed defamation suit amount if she agrees to remain silent. This follows Trump's previous $130,000 payment to Daniels during his 2016 campaign. MSNBC obtained relevant documents confirming the new proposal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Prisoners won't return until ... ': Hamas leader Khalil Hayya confirms Yahya Sinwar's death
item.description: Hamas leader Khalil Hayya confirmed the death of Yahya Sinwar, emphasizing that Israeli hostages would only be released if hostilities in Gaza ended and Palestinian prisoners are freed. He stated Sinwar's death would strengthen the group's resolve. Over 42,500 have been killed in Israel's counterattacks following Sinwar's orchestrated assault on October 7.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'White Dudes for Harris' replies to Trump's jibe, asks who 'Melania's boyfriend' is voting for
item.description: "Trump's former love is voting for @KamalaHarris. His wife is, too," the official X account of White Dudes for Harris said in a savage reply to Donald Trump's AI Smith dinner joke. “There’s a group called White Dudes for Harris…but I’m not worried about them…their wives and their wives’ lovers are all voting for me," Trump said in a jibe.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Hasina treated her critics; chilling accounts from secret underground jail in Bangladesh
item.description: Revelations about an underground jail in Bangladesh highlight the brutal methods used during Sheikh Hasina's regime. Critics were abducted, tortured, and often killed, with survivors held in the secretive 'Aynaghor.' Families of the disappeared continue to seek answers and justice for their lost loved ones.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Barron Trump's present girlfriend? Donald Trump says...
item.description: ​"I'm not sure he's there yet," Donald Trump said adding, "I don't think he's had a girlfriend yet". "He doesn't mind being alone, but he's somebody that gets along with people," Trump said. ​A lot of interest is there over Barron' love life and it all started a few years ago when TikToker Maddie claimed she dated Barron Trump when they studied together at Columbia Grammar and Preparatory School in New York. They were kids at that time and then Barron went to a different school leading to their break-up, as claimed by Maddie.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taiwan urges China to reconsider actions amid 'diehard independence separatists' reports
item.description: Taiwan's MAC has urged Beijing to rethink its approach after China's TAO received numerous tips through a system targeting 'diehard Taiwan independence separatists.' TAO's list, including Taiwan's Vice President, aims to punish these individuals to uphold national sovereignty. MAC calls for positive relations despite China's actions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former Australian pilot Greg Lynn sentenced to 32 years for 'brutal' murder of Carol Clay
item.description: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn received a 24-year prison sentence for murdering Carol Clay at a campsite in Victoria. Despite claiming self-defense during a struggle, the jury convicted him of Clay's brutal death. The attempt to cover up the murder and delay in revealing the body’s location added to the family's anguish.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
